contentList:
Damage description that covered Strength, Finesse and Intelligence in Vanilla PowerStrength Name Increases your damage by 3% per point and allows you to lift and carry heavier items.Strength Description Evasion Gives you 2% dodge per point.Finesse Description Evasion Lowered Precision Precision: [1][2]
Precision Precision Lowered Precision Increases your Accuracy by 2% per point.Intelligence Description Increases your Critical Chance by 2% per point and your Initiative by 1 per point. Also increases your ability to detect traps and find hidden treasures.Wits Description +1 point = +[1]% Critical Chance.Wits Tooltip OffenceCharacter Sheet "Weapon Abilities" section LifestealTwo-Handed Name Gives 10% Lifesteal per pointTwo-Handed Description Next Level [1]: [1]0% Lifesteal.Two-Handed Tooltip for Next Level Level [1]: [1]0% Lifesteal.Two-Handed Tooltip for Current Level Single-HandedSingle Handed Name Single-Handed Description.Single Handed Description Single-Handed Next LevelSingle Handed Tooltip for Next Level Single-Handed Current LevelSingle Handed Tooltip for Current Level Long RangeRanged Name Increases the range from your ranged attacks and skills by 1m per point.

This range increase affects ranged weapon attacks, dome, jump, multistrike, projectile, projectile strike, rain, rush, storm, summon, ranged target, teleportation, tornado and wall skills. Doesnâ€™t increase the range on melee weapon attacks, cone, quake, shout, melee target and zone skills.
Ranged Description Next Level [1]: +[1]m Range.Ranged Tooltip for Next Level Level [1]: + [1]m Range.Ranged Tooltip for Current Level SpeedDual Wielding Name Increases your movement speed by 0.3m per pointDual Wielding Description Next Level [1] + [1] * 0.3mDual Wielding Tooltip for Next Level Level [1]: +[1] * 0.3mDual Wielding Tooltip for Current Level Retribution NameRetribution Name Retribution DescriptionRetribution Description Retribution Tooltip for Next LevelRetribution Tooltip for Next Level Retribution Tooltip for Current LevelRetribution Tooltip for Current Level Armor SpecialityPerseverance Name Decrease all damage dealt to you while your armor is up by 10% per point.

Doesn't reduce piercing, shadow and armor damages.
Reduction is applied before resistances and vulnerabilities.
Perseverance Description Next Level [1]: +[1]0% reduction.Perseverance Tooltip for Next Level Level [1]: [1]0% reduction.Perseverance Tooltip for Next Level LeadershipLeadership Name Damaging an enemy close to you causes all your allies to gain 10% dodge per point during the enemy's turn.

You need to be up to 5 m from the enemy when dealing the damage and at their turn start.Leadership Description Next Level [1]: +[2]% Dodge.Leadership Tooltip for Next Level Level [1]: +[2]% Dodge.Leadership Tooltip for Current Level SkillsCharacter Sheet "Skill" section AerotheurgeAerotheurge Name Lightning and air skills. Focused on Area of Effect, Crowd Control and Teleportations.Aerotheurge Description Aerotheurge Tooltip for Next Level Aerotheurge Tooltip for Current Level HydrosophistHydrosophist Name Water and Ice skills. Focused on Crowd Control, Buffs, Healing and Armor Restoration.Hydrosophist Description Hydrosophist Tooltip for Next Level Hydrosophist Tooltip for Current Level GeomancerGeomancer Name Earth and Poison skills. Focused on Area of Effect Damage, Soft Crowd Control, Armor Restoration and Damage Per Turn.Geomancer Description Geomancer Tooltip for Next Level Geomancer Tooltip for Current Level PyrokineticPyrokinetic Name Fire skills. Focused on Area of Effect Damage and Buffs.Pyrokinetic Description Pyrokinetic Tooltip for Next Level Pyrokinetic Tooltip for Current Level NecromancerNecromancer Name Blood and Undead skills. Focused on Buffs, Debuffs and Damage.Necromancer Description Necromancer Tooltip for Next Level Necromancer Tooltip for Current Level HuntsmanHuntsman Name Skills for Bow users.Huntsman Description Huntsman Tooltip for Next Level Huntsman Tooltip for Current Level SummoningSummoning Name Increases your summons base stats and attributes. Upon reaching 5 Summoning, your Incarnate gain increased size and more attributes.Summoning Description Next Level [1]: Summons start with [2]% more Vitality, Damage, and Armor.Summoning Tooltip for Next Level Level [1]: Summons start with [2]% more Vitality, Damage, and Armor.Summoning Tooltip for Current Level PolymorphPolymorph Name Provides 1 free Attribute Point per point invested.Polymorph Description ScoundrelScoundrel Name Skills for Dagger users.Scoundrel Description Scoundrel Tooltip for Next Level Scoundrel Tooltip for Current Level WarfareWarfare Name Skills for Melee Weapon users.Warfare Description Warfare Tooltip for Next Level Warfare Tooltip for Current Level (Innate) The PawnThe Pawn Name The Pawn permits your character [2] AP worth of free movement per turn.

This is an Innate Talent. It is automatically assigned for all Characters.The Pawn Description (Innate) Savage SortilegeSavage Sortilege Name Savage Sortilege gives all magical skills a critical chance equal to your critical chance score.

This is an Innate Talent. It is automatically assigned for all Characters.Savage Sortilege Description (Innate) OpportunistOpportunist Name Opportunist gives you the ability to perform attacks of opportunity.

This is an Innate Talent. It is automatically assigned for all Characters.Opportunist Description This bonuses are applied automatically, without needing to possess the talent.
Lone Wolf provides +2 Max, Starting and Recovery AP, +30% Vitality and Armor, and doubles invested points in attributes. This bonus is temporarily removed while there are more than two members in the current party.Lone Wolf Description Restore [1] equal to damage dealt. Damage is based on your level and receives bonus from Strength. Damage is based on your attack and receives a bonus from Strength. Damage may be reduced by resistances. The stats of the summons will depend on the caster's level and attributes. Huntsman skills advance archers and rangers. A high level of Finesse improves these skills' reach, while Strength improves their damage. Read this book to learn this skill. Warfare skills are skills for warriors. High Strength improves some of these skills. Read this book to learn this skill. Conjure a personal elemental that matches the ground surface it's summoned onto. Your Incarnate can be buffed with Infusions. Once you hit Summoning ability level of 5, a colossal Incarnate Champion will answer your summons! Black-Hearted [1] characters suffer damage from all healing effects - including potions - but gain 50% Lifesteal. They cannot benefit from Blessed. In combat, their Bless skill also becomes its opposite... Braveheart Characters with Braveheart are considered a priority target by enemies in melee, but cannot flee from combat. In addition, attacks of opportunity provoke immediate retaliation from Braveheart. [1] lets you heal from poison, but regular healing will damage you instead. With [1], the duration of damage statuses caused by you is extended by one turn. Burning, Poisoned, Bleeding, Necrofire, Acid, Suffocating, Entangled, Death Wish, Shackles of Pain and Ruptured Tendons are affected by this talent. Hydrosophist skills are Water-based magic spells. High Strength improves these skills' damage. Read this book to learn this skill. Minor Wisdom Potion Foolishness Potion Medium Wisdom Potion Large Wisdom Potion Permanent Wisdom Potion Fan of Blades Fan of Blades Skillbook Graft Flesh Graft Flesh Scroll Graft Flesh Skillbook Graft Flesh Elemental Weapons Skillbook Willpower increased. Attacking enemies will become Chilled. Egalitarian [1] equally distributes statuses you successfully receive to all other characters within 3m. [1] absorbs blood surfaces to heal you and restores a small amount of Vitality when any nearby character dies. [1] refunds used skillbooks. In combat, using three skills of the same school in a row restores 1 Action Point. Academic Reptile Regrowth Scroll Reptile Regrowth Skillbook [1] reduces the cost of using grenades and scrolls by [2] AP when your offhand is free. Additionally, your first equipment change per turn costs nothing. [1] enables you to talk to animals. Beasts of the wild will occasionally come to your aid when you strike a foe. [1] gives you +[2]% extra Vitality and +2% to all Resistances (including physical) for every point in Warfare. A character with [1] has an extra [2]% [3], but takes a [4]% penalty to [5]. Demon gives an additional +3% Fire Resistance each time a Pyrokinetic spell is cast, while Ice King gives immunity to Chilled, Frozen and Slipping. [1] gives you [2]% Dodging while dual wielding. When missed by an attack in close range, you retaliate. While sneaking, [1] increases attack damage by [2]% and causes attacks to inflict Atrophy. Also reduces cost of entering sneak mode by [3] AP. [1] increases the range of skills and scrolls by [2]m and boosts your damage by 10%. Enemy characters within 4 meters decrease your damage by 20%, however. Arrow Efficiency [1] gives you [2]% chance to recover a special arrow after shooting it, and a separate [2]% chance to immediately repeat a special arrow attack. Grafted Flesh Applies Slowed. Chance of Frost Aegis, which protects the wearer against statuses. Frost Aegis [Resolve Persuasion] [Intellect Persuasion] [Wisdom Persuasion]
